metadata.title: CVE-2019-9948 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
urllib in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 supports the local_file: scheme, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms thatblacklist file: URIs, as demonstrated by triggering aurllib.urlopen('local_file:///etc/passwd') call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.16-2
python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.16-2').
